snippet: After stepping down as New York’s chief administrative judge, Ann Pfau is trying jury cases for the first time, as an acting justice on the State Supreme Court.
abstract: Ann Pfau, former chief administrative judge for New York State, is now an acting justice on the State Supreme Court, trying jury cases for the first time in her career; says the task has been a daunting crash course in the most fundamental aspects of the bench, including the necessity of developing a good poker face.
lead_paragraph: After stepping down as New York’s chief administrative judge, Ann Pfau is trying jury cases for the first time, as an acting justice on the State Supreme Court.

headline.seo: Ann Pfau, Veteran Judge, Gets a Crash Course on the Bench
headline.main: At 64, a Longtime Judge Receives a Crash Course On the Ways of the Bench
